alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 11:38PM CDT until July 06 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Deaf Smith and Randall. * WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1138 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hereford, Canyon, Dawn, Buffalo Lake, Umbarger and Mescalero Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
